config.question: Which of the following factors led to the decline of the great cattle drives?

choices.content: the invention of the barbed wire used in fences
the fall in the demand for beef in the North

answer_3.response: By 1880, more than 6 million cattle had been driven to northern markets. But the era of the great cattle drive was ending. Farmers were planting wheat on the old buffalo ranges; barbed wire, a recent invention, cut across the trails and divided up the big ranches.
